description:
Finance Project Managers drive critical priorities for Google by leading and assisting in projects of all sizes. Drawing from your strong financial background, you work with a diverse team to manage projects from concept to implementation and keep Google-wide stakeholders informed as you go. You get down into the details of complex analyses without losing sight of the overall objective. When working on multiple projects at once, you intuitively know which issues to highlight and can bring key decision makers together to come up with effective solutions. Once a project is completed, you're able to clearly communicate the results and draw the key learnings for senior management. You are efficient and organized, making the most of everyone's abilities and holding the team to a high standard.

As a Project Analyst you will work to define and launch strategic and operational initiatives to help the business scale globally, collaborate with Google teams, and embed an external market point-of view into the strategic direction of the group and company. You will own and manage projects or parts of larger initiatives, both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis, successfully supporting strategic decision-making through analysis and presentation of findings to senior management and the broader organization. You have mastered the cycle of project planning to delivery and associated techniques, and use this knowledge to develop team work plans and manage workloads and deadlines.

As a Finance Project Business Process Lead, you will manage your assignments through the entire project lifecycle working closely with Finance, Corporate Engineering teams and Professional Services Partners to deliver on goals. You'll work with Finance teams on complex projects in a matrix team structure to align on objectives, define requirements, design new business processes and data, structure and implement projects, engage and communicate status to stakeholders.

In this role, you will work closely with multiple groups leveraging your knowledge of Finance processes and systems to build relationships and develop solutions that meet our future business requirements. Additionally, you'll leverage an understanding of Finance processes in the areas of Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A), Management, and Internal Reporting, to evaluate alternatives, guide decision making, solve challenges, provide analytical insight, and business judgment to support strategic and tactical initiatives across the organization.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in a business analyst function - defining business requirements, evaluation of solution options/alternatives, business process and data design with teams inside and outside Finance, business process documentation.
  • Experience with large ERP platforms and Finance business processes in area of FP&A, Management and Internal Reporting.
  • Experience operating in large projects and throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), implementing cross-functional transformation initiatives.

Preferred qualifications:

  • CPA/CA/MBA, Advanced Professional Degree.
  • Understanding of Finance systems.
  • Excellent business acumen, with the ability to lead discussions with executives to obtain key decisions.
  • Excellent change management skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-moving, dynamic environment.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Detail/ deadline oriented with effective organizational and analytical and documentation skills.
  • Effective problem solving, process improvement and analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Structure projects with your team and stakeholders - define objectives and success criteria. Develop comprehensive plans and lead your projects through the entire project lifecycle for quality delivery of scope, on-time, within budget and achieve success criteria.
  • Collaborate with Finance teams, establish and lead working group meetings to understand as-is, identify gaps/propose improvements, evaluate solution alternatives, prioritize requirements, identify and design data , and drive consensus to achieve agreed set of requirements. Resolve issues that arise for areas of responsibility keeping in mind impacts to the project timeline and to other programs/projects.
  • Provide stakeholder management, engagement and alignment critical for project success including clearly communicating status, risks and remediation plans to executive stakeholders.
  • Partner with Finance stakeholders to plan and deliver change management to ensure new processes and technology are deployed effectively and adopted by the organization.
  • Define and measure key metrics for your areas of responsibility in order to measure business impact of process improvements.
title: Finance Project Business Process Lead, Management and Internal Reporting
